website_summaries.verdict: Though it doesn't rank first based on any individual aspect of the camera, the Nikon D5100 delivers a solid combination of image quality, performance, features, and design that puts it out in front if you're looking for a well-rounded option under $1,000.
pros: Excellent photo quality with a good noise profile, a streamlined shooting design for both photo and video, and a broad, practical feature set contribute to the Nikon D5100's strengths
cons: While it's fast, some aspects of the D5100's performance still lag behind its class

customer_reviews.title: nikon d5100 review
customer_reviews.text: I also have the D7100 i just bought this camera to use for a second view on food videos. If you are able buy a 7000 series. This camera is so basic very light I would not put any of my good lenses on this body. It does serve the purpose of the second view on videos i would not buy this camera for my main camera. Spend a little more and get a 7000 series.
customer_reviews.author: carla

customer_reviews.title: Replacement for My D70 - Overall Pretty Okay
customer_reviews.text: My D70 developed problems and the repair price was more than the price of this replacement. The only disappointment is that the camera body is smaller than the D70 and there is not quite enough camera there for my average size hands to grasp. I prefer the size of the D70 in terms of how balanced it feels with a lens attached. That said, the camera works well and has a number of welcome features not on the D70. I will adjust in time.
customer_reviews.author: J. P. Clark

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic Camera
customer_reviews.text: This camera is just fantastic. I paired it with an 18-200mm lens, and while traveling through Alaska, it was great. It is much lighter than previous generations. My favorite feature, however, has to be the flip-out screen. While it is not needed 90% of the time, the 10% of the time that I use it, it allows me to get shots I couldn't otherwise get. Although the reviews say it doesn't handle as well as the D3100, which is true, it still handles very well, and feels at home with either my huge 18-200mm lens, or my small 18-55 lens (upgraded from the 18-55, but I still have it if I want a smaller lens or better macro).
customer_reviews.author: Alex

customer_reviews.title: Big step up at modest price
customer_reviews.text: Bought this at a great price. Nikon was clearing inventory in an advance of the D5200. It has a lot of features I don't expect to use but that's what you have to accept to get the ones one wants. I was deciding between this and the D3200. The key features this had but were lacking on the D3200 were AEB and the movasble LCD screen which lets me avoid "belly photography" in some circumstances. It is an upgrade to my D60. Image quality nod definately better -- it's not just the pixel count -- specifcly lower noise (it doesn't change much from ISO100 levels ontill you approad ISO400), and EV range is about 2 stops greater.
customer_reviews.author: Desert Rat

customer_reviews.title: Great Camera
customer_reviews.text: Firstly, Amazon's delivery was very fast. I had the camera 4 days after I ordered it with standard shipping. Great job. The Camera itself is a great step up from what is now my secondary camera, the D60. Focus is nice and crisp, and even on the Sports setting, the camera is lightning fast. There is a lot to this camera, so read the manual first ! ! I also purchased a battery grip for it, and you will find that does make up for the camera's compact size (the only drawback I have encountered so far). Great job Nikon.
customer_reviews.author: David R. Hughes

customer_reviews.title: BEST PURCHASE EVER!!!!
customer_reviews.text: ....i am just a person who loves to take photos....and when i decided to upgrade finally to a dslr camera from a simple shooter i didnt hesitate to purchase a nikon camera....after much research, i found that the d5100 is just perfect for me and my skill level of photographing....after owning this over a year i am still discovering all of the amazing functions it can do....of course the photos look amazing and it makes me happy!....i have already got 2 lenses for it with a recent purchase of a 18-300mm lens....now my camera is complete and totally awesome....Amazon as always does a great job!
customer_reviews.author: Vikki

customer_reviews.title: Better then advertised.
customer_reviews.text: I was more then pleased with this purchase. The camera was in excellent condition and has been performing well. It arrived earlier then expected. I bought an extra battery and battery grip. It will be the companion camera to my Nikon D3200,so I don't have to change lenses when out shooting pictures. Great deal, $49 less then any that were on ebay. Love it!
customer_reviews.author: Brian Ellis

customer_reviews.title: Upgraded from my D40x and I love this camera!!
customer_reviews.text: This camera is great! I'm always on a budget and this one fits the bill perfectly. I loved my D40x, but unfortunately, it's seen it's time and I had to get a replacement. This is a great entry-level DSLR. Very affordable which gives me more spending money on lenses. I'm not a professional photographer, this is just a very passionate hobby of mine, so this DLSR fits my needs perfectly in affordability and function. There are tons of reviews of this camera on Youtube. I definitely recommend checking those out as it's nice to see a video of it in action.
customer_reviews.author: Robert

customer_reviews.title: Sharp as a tack
customer_reviews.text: I like: getting back to SLR-style shooting. The camera's quick focusing. Stunning shots even in the sneered-at, unloved DX format. The articulating screen was 50% of why I went with this model. Don't like: the overall feel that I'm only using a point'n'shoot on steroids. The pop-up onboard flash: why oh why is it on an SLR? If I want a flash I'll mount one; too often it pops up when I don't want it and casts shadows when I use a long lens. For an entry-level Nikon, my first, I am happy.
customer_reviews.author: David A. Steinberg

customer_reviews.title: Nikon D5100 - a great DSLR value
customer_reviews.text: I bought this from KEH as a factory-refurb and it was as if it was brand spanking new! New box, new cables, new battery, new strap, new booklet and the body was PERFECT, as described by the seller. I charged the battery overnight and began shooting the next day and haven't stopped. With my Nikon lens, it is working just great and I recommend the D5100 before I'd spend $2,000 or more on a "pro" model that won't shoot any better quality photos than the D5100. I own a D80 also and both are plenty of megapixels to achieve great photo quality.
customer_reviews.author: Nikonman

customer_reviews.title: Great camera, regardless of price!
customer_reviews.text: Purchased the camera to replace my aging (but still fully operational) Nikon D40. I was specifically looking for something with improved low light capabilities. This camera delivers that in spades. The camera combined with my 1.2 lens is letting me take pictures in locations and light levels that I didn't think were possible to do handheld. It is pretty sturdy, and not much heavier than the D40. Highly recommended if you are outgrowing your entry level camera and want a more prosumer type camera that can grow with you. Bonus: it can mount virtually any Nikon lens ever made. Usually have mine fitted with vintage glass...
customer_reviews.author: Juan Camargo

customer_reviews.title: Outstanding!
customer_reviews.text: This Nikon D5100 replaced a Nikon D40 that had died. It's several generations improved, and has features that I didn't even expect, such as the intervalometer. Video is certainly icing on the cake as well. The discounted price was too low to pass up. Also, Amazon's service was truly amazing. The order was placed on 12/20, and the camera was delivered on 12/24, free shipping! My only complaint is that the delivery person didn't knock or ring the door bell, so we didn't discover it until later sitting on the front porch in plain sight.
customer_reviews.author: inconspicuous consumer

customer_reviews.title: Nice camera
customer_reviews.text: I really like the monitor screen that is adjustable. I can get really low with the camera and not have to lay on the ground, or hold the camera high and see the composition. It is compatible with my telephoto, wide and macro lens. Great camera for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Joel

customer_reviews.title: Good Product
customer_reviews.text: The Camera body works fine and has no damage on it at all. For a camera body it works very well and was a good buy. It came with an off brand, used, Digipower battery instead of a Nikon battery. This will still work the same and isn't a huge downside. Packaging was a little sketch, my box had Kirkland signature water bottle packaging and paper that obviously came from a recycling bin off the street in the box for protection.
customer_reviews.author: Gregory M.

customer_reviews.title: Still one of the best DSLRs at this price.
customer_reviews.text: Such a great camera. Great features for an amateur or amateur-pro. Still holds up well to newer DSLRs in the same category. One of the best DSLRs in this price point. The only reason I want to upgrade right now is because the Sony mirror-less cameras are looking so great...but the ones I want are also much more expensive than this.
customer_reviews.author: MagicalCatboy

customer_reviews.title: YES!!!
customer_reviews.text: The camera arrived in perfect condition and I am very happy
customer_reviews.author: Steven Lowe

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Camera and easy to work with!!
customer_reviews.text: This camera was purchased a couple years ago and I can honestly say I STILL LOVE IT!!! I use it frequently and has so many amazing features. This is my 3rd Nikon. My first was a 35mm. My second was the D3000 I am looking forward to when the next new series comes out. There was not enough change in the 7000 series to warrant an upgrade.
customer_reviews.author: Striker

customer_reviews.title: Works Great with My Older Lenses
customer_reviews.text: This camera was bought when D70s quit working correctly and fixing it would cost nearly as much as a new D5100 body. It's lighter and smaller but feels well balanced and focuses very quickly with a 18-70mm Nikkor Zoom Lens and a 55-200mm (Vibration Reduction) Nikkor Zoom Lens used previously. It provides a step up with much better ISO light sensitivity, resolution and focusing. We haven't taken enough pictures yet to comment about its reliabiltiy.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas L Elberson

customer_reviews.title: Your memories are priceless
customer_reviews.text: The picture quality of the D7000 for a much more affordable price. Our pictures are our memories and they are priceless, no one would differ on that. If your budget is limited (as it always is) it is absolutely a better consideration to invest in picture quality than in functionality. And this camera gives one of the best compromise price vs picture quality. You won't be disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: D. Maarek

customer_reviews.title: auto setting queen
customer_reviews.text: Wore out my first one doing rapid shots on auto settings, after 9 years, so bought another. I love my camera!
customer_reviews.author: Featherburry

customer_reviews.title: good camera
customer_reviews.text: yes there is a newer one but this one works fine. bought it to move up from a D3000 and it was a good move. while the newer with more megapixels might be better for some with what i do with this camera it's fine. the tilting LCD screen is why i kept it when getting a new camera. also have a D7100 which will do things this one won't but has more bulk and weight.
customer_reviews.author: dave

customer_reviews.title: wow
customer_reviews.text: i have a canon t3 and this product blows it away, better color better lcd, better live view, many special effects, easy to use, i bought this used because i already have several ol nikon lenses and to keep the price down. even though used it came in an original box- with cd rom etc, it actually cannot be told from new, works just great, just got it yesterday and have shoot 200 pictures- thanks amazon warehouse deals
customer_reviews.author: rocky1

customer_reviews.title: Better than the D3200
customer_reviews.text: This was my first time shopping around for a nice entry level DSLR camera. I have had a 7 year old point and shoot camera. I was deciding to go with the D3200 but a photography hobbyist friend mentioned and recommended me this camera over the D3200. The price was a 100 bucks less but was only for the body. I purchased a Sigma 18-200 lens and love my new camera. Cant go wrong.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Love this camera!
customer_reviews.text: My wife and I shoot a local short track asphalt racing. We had purchased a Nikon D7000 and needed another camera but couldn't quite swing the cost of another. After researching we found that the D5100 shared a lot of the same features as the D7000 at a considerable savings. While the D7000 does have a few advantages of the D5100, for the money we feel like we made a good decision.
customer_reviews.author: Nick

customer_reviews.title: Great camera for the enthusiast and beginner
customer_reviews.text: Great camera for the enthusiast and beginner. Lots of menu options and the camera performs well, the flip viewfinder is really helpful for difficult to reach angles and I have used it extensively when taking pictures to make sure my focus is spot on. the only downside is the fps, it seems to have a slow lag time between shots, so it is not ideal for portraits or street photography unless you have an auto focus lens. otherwise, it is a good camera and good value for beginners
customer_reviews.author: George Njiiri

customer_reviews.title: Still learning
customer_reviews.text: I'm still learning to use the camera mainly because When I purchased a disc to format for the camera, I could not format it with the camera. I'm trying to determine if the D5100 needs a specific disc or if there is something wrong with the camera. I used the disc from my D40 and was able to operate the camera and when I switched the new disc to my D40 it is operational. With the transferred disc the D5100 seem to work beautifully , but i'm trying to determine if there is an internal problem with the camera or just the fact that I'm not understanding something about formating the disc.
customer_reviews.author: Wesley L Bell

customer_reviews.title: Best camera for a Photography Entusiast
customer_reviews.text: I own this camera for about 1 month and its great! Easy to use, and with lots of features to play with. You can't ask more for that price, and its got the same sensor as the D7000. The grip is soft and well fitted to your hand. Its a little small, but you can get a battery grip at amazon for a low price. The battery life is excellent, i suggest you pick up another one if you are a travel photographer. this camera its absolutely what i needed for...i hope to get another model in a few years.
customer_reviews.author: Santiago Sack

customer_reviews.title: Good camera!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this camera as a "back-up" camera to my Nikon D80 and also for the purpose of recording videos. For the price, it's a great camera! Using my 35mm lens, it record very crisp video and the sound quality isn't terrible, either! I'd definitely recommend it for someone wanting a more simple DSLR with the ability to record!
customer_reviews.author: Amber

customer_reviews.title: Awesome camera!
customer_reviews.text: This is my second Nikon D5100. I bought this as a backup. Awesome camera!
customer_reviews.author: Manny Correira

customer_reviews.title: Amazing camera!
customer_reviews.text: All of my digital cameras have been point and shoots since I quit using my Olympus 35 mm camera. This camera is totally amazing! You don't have to be a good photographer to get wonderful shots. I bought the 18 mm to 105 mm lens. I am loving taking photographs again....THANK YOU NIKON for such a great camera at a reasonable price!
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth Deems

customer_reviews.title: It's a good camera
customer_reviews.text: I am semi-new at photography and want to learn EVERYTHING. I have a D3200 that I have been learning on and decided to try others. I bought this camera and another camera at the same time. This is a step up from the D3200 and is a really nice camera. I like it a lot. I would recommend this camera.
customer_reviews.author: Kim Braden

customer_reviews.title: I'll keep it for generations...
customer_reviews.text: Best DSLR to begin... It's stunning... I have no feeling of being amateur... The battery life in live mode is poor, but that's something I rarely use... Get a fast SD card... good lens and you are ready to shooooot...!!! It's simple, it's NIkon... ;)
customer_reviews.author: Stitch

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Semi-Pro Camera
customer_reviews.text: Beautiful camera that gives wonderful detailed photographs, far more detail than the typical consumer level camera. This camera has the same sensor and processor as it's big brother the D7000. I strongly recommend this if you want your photography to go to a "next level" but without the serious cost of a full frame Nikon.
customer_reviews.author: Scott M

customer_reviews.title: Nikon D5100  Quality images easily obtained !
customer_reviews.text: Wanted a quality camera for a begining photographer. The D-5100 is light weight, yields beautiful images printed at 11.5 x 17 inches, learning to change settings on controlls by using navigator dial on rear is quick and easy, and there is a help button on the right rear side with quick hints. The rotating rear screen lets you aquire images at odd angles. The top of the camera does not have a settings window on the right side, but the simple push of a button opens a window with setting data on the rear screen. BOTTOM LINE: We took two of these on a recent trip, and both new photographers aquired beautiful shots.
customer_reviews.author: Jerry Apple

customer_reviews.title: What are you waiting for!?  Buy it!!
customer_reviews.text: There are so many lengthy, detailed reviews about this camera, written by experienced photographers. If you're truly serious about buying an SLR camera, then I assume you've already done your homework and read these reviews. So, there's really only one more thing I can add to these reviews, especially as a beginner in photography: WHAT ARE YOU WAITING FOR!?! This camera is AWESOME. Quit reading about it and just buy it already!! It is every bit as good as everyone says it is. JUST. DO. IT.
customer_reviews.author: CCP

customer_reviews.title: love it
customer_reviews.text: I love this camera! I am new to the nicer cameras and this was a great start!
customer_reviews.author: Laura Pasatiempo

customer_reviews.title: Very satisfied with it!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this camera for my brother. He loves it. I don't know anything about these cameras, but my brother has taken so many great pictures and video with this one. He mentioned something about the sound when he uses the camera for video not being the best, but other than that he is very happy with the quality of this item.
customer_reviews.author: TRIBALFREAK

customer_reviews.title: Engineers Review
customer_reviews.text: Wife uses this camera daily. Don't be fooled by the need to buy more expensive cameras under the guise of megapixels. This camera has plenty of resolution for great pictures with wide angle or zoom lens'. Works great with the 18-200VRII
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Smile!
customer_reviews.text: Time of use at review - Months (ish) PROs - Bigger and better than anything I've used to date (coming from the D40 and D70)... too many features to list, my suggestion is to go to Nikon's site or read the review of people who know what they're talking about, I'll be busy out shooting this camera!! CONs - Doesn't fly? RATING - 5 stars because there aren't anymore to give RECOMMEND - YES, I use this camera for everything taking pictures/video of the moon, California beach, road trips, hiking, family functions, holidays... practically everything you take pictures of and learning more every time I take it out.
customer_reviews.author: T-Virus

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: awesome camera for beginers even this days . The sensor of this camera was revolutionary.
customer_reviews.author: yessen bruce

customer_reviews.title: I love it.
customer_reviews.text: This is one of the best buys that I have purchased on Amazon in the past 3 years. I love this camera as I make a of videos and the swivel screen helps ensure that you are able to get awkward situations (such as the need to put the camera over your head or down to the florr)
customer_reviews.author: Phi Beta Sigma Man

customer_reviews.title: Can't put it down!
customer_reviews.text: Love, love love it! Def need 32GB SD card to do video and pics. Seems to be better when you use the viewfinder instead of the screen for still pics. I use it all the time! I was between this one and the D7000 and the differences weren't worth the price difference.
customer_reviews.author: bellaree

customer_reviews.title: Improvement on D 80
customer_reviews.text: Right out of the box using the same lens (18 - 200 VR)this camera takes better pictures than my previous Nikon D80. I bought the body only. I am a family photographer and the D5100 is the ideal Nikon camera for me. Simple to use, lightweight, video if necessary, and well priced. I considered the D7000, but in reality, I would never use the added feature set and have instead bought a 35mm Prime lens and an extra battery and am still $300 ahead! Photos thus far have been great, without the frustration of obvious exposure issues I experienced with the D80.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Nice Camera
customer_reviews.text: Delivered as promised and, while packaged funny,seemed to be what was advertised. I've used it a couple of times and it has performed as expected. It's a gamble you take any time you purchase gear that doesn't come right out of the Nikon box.
customer_reviews.author: Frank

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: I had a D3100 that was damaged & needed to be replaced. I needed body only, so upgraded to this one. I love it! Its quick & has some cool features that are fun to play with, such as the single color effects.( the 3100 did not have). The rotating screen is really nice for video. I prefer to use the viewfinder for stills. It also came delivered on time.
customer_reviews.author: cliff jumper

customer_reviews.title: Best Price, Best Buy and Best Nikon anywhere
customer_reviews.text: It does everything I want plus some. like the live view and dedicated record button. The flip open LCD keeps my screen clean and protected you can't find that on any other camera. You have to purchase a protective cover BUT not for this camera. Was kinda shocked it was so small. for girly hands that I don't have. That's why I bout the extra battery grip.
customer_reviews.author: Noah Williams

customer_reviews.title: Just amazing
customer_reviews.text: This is my fourth Nikon camera, and my first DSLR. I'm coming from a pleasant experience with the Nikon P80. I wanted something 'more' and that's it! I read all the possible reviews around the web (very good the ones of dpreview and cameralabs) and I decided to go for it. I have it since one month and I didn't regretted a single shot! Just amazing. Recommended to whom want something more than entry-level and can't afford to change body every other year...
customer_reviews.author: Alex

customer_reviews.title: Nikon Does it Again
customer_reviews.text: I bought this camera as an upgrade from my D5000 and I would have to say I'm pretty pleased so far. I really like the more compact body and the greatly improved LCD. I'm shooting with the Nikkor 16-85mm lens and the shots look excellent. At the default settings the jpegs are kinda soft, but if you shoot in RAW you can sharpen them up in ViewNX and they come out looking excellent. The button placement is a bit strange but it is nice that you can now access most of the buttons with your right hand. The first body I received had focusing issues, but Amazon provided excellent customer service and sent me out a new one right away.
customer_reviews.author: Brad A. Parke

customer_reviews.title: Takes a good memory.
customer_reviews.text: My boys are taking some very high quality photos with the two the bought. Good multifunctional body if your memory is good enough to use it. A lot of bells and whistles.
customer_reviews.author: J. W. Rittenhouse II

customer_reviews.title: Great Video Tool.
customer_reviews.text: Great Video Tool. I produce and host a local cable TV Show and we use a few of these in making our video for the show. Works so much better than I had expected. Looking to pick up a few D7100's next to work with these.
customer_reviews.author: Wesley C. Brooks

customer_reviews.title: I really like the camera and decided to just replace for the ...
customer_reviews.text: This was to replace my other D5100 that got dropped (I didn't do it). I really like the camera and decided to just replace for the broken one.
customer_reviews.author: lynn

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic camera
customer_reviews.text: I have had a little bit of time to use this camera now and I absolutely love it. I upgraded from the d3000 and its definitely worth the upgrade. I haven't had a chance to delve into the video modes yet however I am loving the features it offers. The flip out screen is fantastic and I like how it flips out the side so it's not in the way. The picture quality is exceptional, even though I have only had it a little while I have only scratched the surface as far as what this camera can do.
customer_reviews.author: ShaneT

customer_reviews.title: good camera for the price
customer_reviews.text: It does what a starter SLR needs to do.. Good color captured. Lightweight. Feels a bit slow in shutter clicks compared to D90 or D7000. But its way better than the earlier D40 and D60 series.. The swivel LCD is convenient.
customer_reviews.author: prash_142

customer_reviews.title: Good camera for little price
customer_reviews.text: I own the D3100 and I purchased the D5100 to have a second camera. I use the D3100 for my telephoto lens and the D5100 for my regular lens. That was the main reason to buy it, but I also love the AEB and HDR features on the D5100.
customer_reviews.author: Heidi Lotter

customer_reviews.title: Great buy!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this camera as my first (and only) DSLR. I am not looking to upgrade in the future. I love this camera. I've tried my friends' D40 and D3100, as well as Canon T3, but there's something really nice about this camera.
customer_reviews.author: Nain

customer_reviews.title: good camera
customer_reviews.text: I'm learning to make this camera work. Turn off all the automatic rubbish and just take good pictures. Start out with the 50mm 1.8 lens. The kit lens is not very good.
customer_reviews.author: bts

customer_reviews.title: excellent! I love everything I can do
customer_reviews.text: excellent! I love everything I can do. takes awesome picture... just be sure to get an AF-S lens and for clearer picture while taking pictures without a tripod get a VR lens!
customer_reviews.author: Chris Pratt

customer_reviews.title: Great camera
customer_reviews.text: I bought this camera years ago, and it's still great. For a used camera it works like a dream,and hasn't given me any problems. It arrived on time and was wrapped really good to prevent breaks no scuffs were on it.
customer_reviews.author: Ezra

customer_reviews.title: Great camera for beginners
customer_reviews.text: Great for a beginner! Easy to use and came speedily and in great condition!
customer_reviews.author: Vyrgo

customer_reviews.title: Nikon - Still one of the best.
customer_reviews.text: This is the second I own in this model. Been shooting Nikons for years. Still one of the best.
customer_reviews.author: John Taylor

customer_reviews.title: Takes great shots but suffers from poor controls...
customer_reviews.text: This camera is mechanically great. I mean, it takes great shots, feels solid, and stands up to the scrutiny Nikon owners have for their gear. HOWEVER... It is very menu intensive and doesn't have the ability to store settings profiles. Every time you need to change settings you have to take you eyes off your subject/environment and sift through menus on the LCD. There is almost nothing that can be switched or changed by feel. Bottom line: Great camera, but it is much more on the "consumer" side of a "pro-sumer" DSLR...
customer_reviews.author: Derek A. Grant

customer_reviews.title: my baby
customer_reviews.text: these item are very helpful i use them every day to go about my every day life whether, thanks for your service.
customer_reviews.author: Vil

customer_reviews.title: And there was a way to make it record in longer segments (cuts off after 20 mins) but other than that it's great.
customer_reviews.text: I wish the battery lasted longer. And there was a way to make it record in longer segments (cuts off after 20 mins) but other than that it's great.
customer_reviews.author: Ashley Long

customer_reviews.title: Better than 5000
customer_reviews.text: Of course yeah? lots of subtle changes that suited me. How things worked and where buttons were placed. I had a 5000 and this is a big improvement I think
customer_reviews.author: Ross Mackintosh

customer_reviews.title: Great Camera
customer_reviews.text: A vast improvement over the 3200 fast lite and a great autofocus feature. I especially like the live view function and the price.
customer_reviews.author: Roger

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Camera with great low light results!
customer_reviews.text: The camera at this price ($469) is a steal. I would advice anyone to get the body only and purchase the Nikkor 35mm 1.8G prime lens. I am a beginner and i discovered my passion for photography with is camera.
customer_reviews.author: Ram

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: This is replacing my analog camera. There is a small learning curve with switching systems, and so far my lenses and filters are interchangeable.
customer_reviews.author: Amazonian

customer_reviews.title: Best camera!
customer_reviews.text: Love the camera! Takes great shots! I'm in love with this camera! I've had it for about 5 months and it's perfect!
customer_reviews.author: Mommyof4

customer_reviews.title: great camera
customer_reviews.text: I upgraded from a Nikon D50 to this Nikon D5100. I went back and forth between the D7000 and the D5100. The D5100 has the same processor as the D7000 and is much cheaper. Even though it is cheaper you will not miss a thing. The quality of the pictures are amazing. The camera is very easy to use and is very simliar to other Nikon cameras so it is a smooth transition. I would highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Kelly S. Johanssen

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: A great camera that despite it's age provides great photos.
customer_reviews.author: J.F.

customer_reviews.title: No complaints!  Great shipping and perfect timing
customer_reviews.text: Looks great came in a timely manner but sticks just a little. I love it though and serves the purpose I needed it for!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Dee

customer_reviews.title: Great camera
customer_reviews.text: This is the best camera I ever got. Delivers great pictures and helped me to improve my photo skills. Really amazing, I really recommend Nikon DSLRs.
customer_reviews.author: Sergio A. S. Santiago

customer_reviews.title: Works well
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my 13 year old Granddaughter that is interested in photography. Easy to use as point and shoot but gives her a camera she can grow with as her knowledge in photography grows.
customer_reviews.author: Lori W.

customer_reviews.title: couldn't wait for it
customer_reviews.text: I really like it. I have enjoyed playing with it as well as taking serious pictures with it. I have also taken pictures outside in different kinds of weather. It has worked really well. I like having the view finder as well as the led screen. I have enjoyed taking pictures with it.
customer_reviews.author: Alicia L. Fisher

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Loving it. Nikon for life. I dabble in amateur photography. This fulfills all of that.
customer_reviews.author: JKR

customer_reviews.title: This camera is a great starter camera and the tilty swivel screen is so ...
customer_reviews.text: This camera is a great starter camera and the tilty swivel screen is so useful. Now that I've moved up to a d600, I feel like I kinda miss the screen on the d5100. Image quality is decent.
customer_reviews.author: Peter Nguyen

customer_reviews.title: but using the conventional viewfinder fixed all those issues and it operates wonderfully in manual and priority modes
customer_reviews.text: Came as expected. Some minor scratching to the LCD screen (minimal), but all in all an insane deal for the price I bought it at. Note to future photographers: I spent the longest time trying to figure out why it was taking multiple exposures with a slow shutter speed. No setting I changed seemed to fix it. Ultimately after consulting the wisdom of the internet, I realized it was due to using live view to frame shots. Not sure if that's a Nikon quirk or what the deal is (think it's mostly used for video), but using the conventional viewfinder fixed all those issues and it operates wonderfully in manual and priority modes.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph M

customer_reviews.title: as expected
customer_reviews.text: This was a Christmas gift for my daughter. She is very happy with it, although she is still learning how to get the best pictures.
customer_reviews.author: Pam M

customer_reviews.title: Great camera
customer_reviews.text: Love the camera. The settings are a little overwhelming at times for beginner. Would recommend an guide to help explain more.
customer_reviews.author: RazorR

customer_reviews.title: Great camera
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to replace my D40, and after looking at the 5200,7000 & the 7100 as well, decided on going the economical route. I'm thrilled with the performance of the camera to date (500+ photos). A nice upgrade from the 40 which I loved. I don't see for my use what more I'd have gotten for a lot more cost with the upgraded models.
customer_reviews.author: Bill Burkavage

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: The speed was surprisingly fast, the color vibrance makes the pictures pop, and the settings explanations inside the camera makes them easier to understand.
customer_reviews.author: Selya Rollins

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Works great. I love my new toy. I am using this body with my old lens.
customer_reviews.author: Naturalmama

customer_reviews.title: Nikond5100
customer_reviews.text: I love this new camera! I thought it would look a bit old caused it was used, but no it looks new! and it took only 3 days! awesome service, highly recommended. The only bad thing about this cam is that the color is not as good as my old nikon d3100, maybe its just the settings, but other than that its amazing :)
customer_reviews.author: Leo Delao

customer_reviews.title: Love this camera!
customer_reviews.text: If you just want to shoot and not fuss around all day with your settings, this is a great camera. I'm used to a larger, heavier camera, so this one seems very light and about a finger's width too small; I was able to remedy that with a battery grip. Be aware that if your lenses aren't AF-S type, they will work with this camera but you will be limited to manual focus.
customer_reviews.author: PJ

customer_reviews.title: NIKON D5100
customer_reviews.text: This is a great product from nikon. Easy to use in all modes and produces spectacular clear pictures. I highly recommend this unit. I piurchased this product thru amazon. it came in quick just as advertised. Stew shein
customer_reviews.author: CAFESTEW

customer_reviews.title: Nikon 5100
customer_reviews.text: The camera does every thing I'm expecting from this nikon product ! I'm still learning about it. I've gotten some real nice shots so far.
customer_reviews.author: wayne a. mitchell

customer_reviews.title: Best buy for the Price
customer_reviews.text: Pros: great list of features and hardware, great range of accessories available that fit this model and future cameras you might decide to get later Cons: None yet. Little bit hard to get started so watch the videos that come with it and the Nikon Starter set. Misc: This is my first DSLR camera that I did a lot of research on before buying.
customer_reviews.author: dreyco

customer_reviews.title: This camera is changing my life
customer_reviews.text: I am in love with this camera!!! I used a Nikon D60 for 5 years. It was wonderful. I knew it inside and out. I thought I had mastered everything I needed to master in the photography world. Then my shutter motor died. I was devastated. I bought this model after doing some research and have not been sorry. The only thing I don't like is it does go through the battery rather quickly ( when shooting long exposures) I will buy an extra battery and be hap hap happy!
customer_reviews.author: Amy Walka

customer_reviews.title: Excelent...the Camera and the Shipping!.
customer_reviews.text: Excelent...the Camera and the Shipping!. Thank you very much for the Camera and your card in the box!. I couldn't be more happier!.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great camera
customer_reviews.text: I've had the camera for a couple of weeks, and I love it. The quality has been overly great in comparison to my old d3000, and the video quality is good as well. Could ask for a bit more manual control over the video, but I'll take what I can get for now. Overall, a great camera and I love using it.
customer_reviews.author: JBurgos92

customer_reviews.title: Nikon D5100
customer_reviews.text: Finally got rid of my old D50 camera body and bought the 5100 body. Takes great pictures and the old lenses still work great on the new camera body.
customer_reviews.author: Dan McCoy

customer_reviews.title: love it
customer_reviews.text: I had to get a new camera because my D60 auto feature mysteriously stopped working. This replacement is a nice upgrade. The additions of having a screen and the video feature have both come in handy. It is lighter than the D60 and the lens can be used on the 5100 body so I only needed to replace the body.
customer_reviews.author: Melissa

customer_reviews.title: Upgraded from the Nikon D40
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to use. I absolutely love having the option to now take hd videos, as the D40 did not have this capability. The modes are all easy to access. Overall I'm extremely happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: Roach

customer_reviews.title: Great upgrade
customer_reviews.text: I recently purchased the D5100 as an upgrade to the D40x I had been shooting with. I am extremely happy with the 5100. I recently did two shoots where I captured images I never could have on my D40x. The D5100 is definitely a great camera for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Marky Mark

customer_reviews.title: Great Camera
customer_reviews.text: I researched cameras for a long time and finally decided on this one. For the price point, you couldn't beat it. Have been very pleased.....now I need to learn how to use it.
customer_reviews.author: David McClintock

customer_reviews.title: Amazing Camera for the price !
customer_reviews.text: This is my first DSLR and i purchased Brand New Nikon D5100 along with Nikon 55-200mm Lens and 50mm 1.8g Lens. The pictures come out amazing. This camera is a must have for the beginners ! Can't go wrong.. Five Star.
customer_reviews.author: gtownguy

customer_reviews.title: Nikon D5100
customer_reviews.text: I love this camera! It is easy to use and the movable display is very convenient. I upgraded from a D80, so the video feature is great.
customer_reviews.author: croc

customer_reviews.title: Great camera
customer_reviews.text: I bought one for my father he loves it. And now this one is for me, I like it very much, great camera.
customer_reviews.author: shane

customer_reviews.title: Excellent!
customer_reviews.text: Love the camera, ease of use with awesome HD vid, great pic, and light weight. Excellent camera once again... thanks Nikon!!!
customer_reviews.author: Regina Kynard

customer_reviews.title: D5100
customer_reviews.text: Amazing, love it! Incredibly sharp detail, crisp clear vivid images head & shoulders above the D3000, D3100. Every bit as good IF not better than the D3200...At 500.00 body only you'd be a fool not to buy this! Outstanding shots with the 55-200mm lens & 55-300mm
customer_reviews.author: Brian Pitts

product_meta.title: Nikon D5100 16.2MP CMOS Digital SLR Camera with 3-Inch Vari-Angle LCD Monitor (Body Only)
product_meta.description:
Style:Body Only| Product Packaging:Standard PackagingFROM THE MANUFACTURER






The Nikon D5100 offers a host of new photographic and video tools that deliver superior performance and exceptional image quality with surprising versatility. With 16.2 megapixels, a swivel Vari-Angle LCD monitor, full HD movie capabilities, new EFFECTS Mode and new HDR setting, you hold the power and performance to capture beautiful moments and the freedom to get creative.




VARI-ANGLE LCD MONITOR
CREATIVITY FROM ANY POINT OF VIEW
Take pictures or record movies from a unique viewpoint, the D5100’s 3.0 inch, super sharp, 921,000-dot Vari-angle LCD monitor allows for versatile high quality viewing and playback. Explore every angle, with overhead shots, waist level candids, ground level and fun self portraits; you will never miss a shot. This Vari-angle monitor allows you to be creative from any point of view.





EFFECTS MODE
MORE FUN AND ARTISTIC PICTURES AND MOVIES
The D5100 incorporates an amazing array of special effects for use when taking still pictures or recording D-Movie Full HD movies. Selective Color isolates any color within the scene, capture details in places too dark for your own eyes using Night Vision, create bright, glowing images filled with atmosphere with High Key, emphasize the mood of a scene using Low Key, Miniature Effect makes a scene look like a miniature scale model and Color Sketch creates color outlines of the subject that are played back as a series of stills in a slide show.





TELL BETTER STORIES
FULL HD 1080P D-MOVIE WITH SOUND
The D5100 delivers exceptionally high-quality movie performance due to its full HD capability while the latest in full-time autofocus takes the guess work out of tracking your subjects while in motion. Effortless moviemaking is at your fingertip thanks to D5100’s ergonomically placed Live View and Movie start button. Your D-Movies will come to life thanks to D5100’s sound recording capability — get stereo sound with Nikon’s optional ME-1 Stereo Microphone.







HDR (HIGH DYNAMIC RANGE)
EXQUISITE DETAIL IN HIGHLIGHT AND SHADOW
In scenes with extreme contrasts, such as bright, sunlit clouds and a foreground deep in shadow, it was once quite difficult to render the textures of both equally. Not any more. D5100 combines two exposures to create an image revealing an extremely wide dynamic range, but with less noise and richer color gradation than ever before.





STUNNING IMAGE QUALITY
IMAGE QUALITY IN A CLASS OF ITS OWN
Incorporating the latest Nikon D-SLR technologies such as the 16.2MP DX-format CMOS sensor and EXPEED 2 image processing engine, the D5100 delivers outstanding image quality. Its CMOS sensor offers a remarkably wide ISO range (ISO 100 to 6400) with reduced noise which enables you to shoot at faster shutter speeds and capture scenes and subjects with less blur. Handheld shooting and full HD movies come out looking great even in low light.








SPEED AND PERFORMANCE THAT DELIVERS
With high-speed continuous shooting at approx. 4 frames per second, you’ll never miss a moment and with D5100’s large optical viewfinder providing accurate and realistic composition, you’ll get a precise view and focus in every situation.





CAPTURE YOUR SUBJECTS PRECISELY
D5100’s 11-point AF system provides flexibility to compose the shot you want ensuring your subject is captured sharply wherever it’s located in the frame. Working together with the Scene Recognition System, the camera can keep your main subject in focus even if the composition changes using Nikon’s exclusive 3D-tracking.
feature_bullets: 3-inch, 921,000-dot Super-Density horizontal type Vari-Angle LCD Monitor
In-camera Special Effects Mode and HDR (High Dynamic Range)
Stunning Full 1080p HD Movies with Full Time Autofocus
High Resolution 16.2 MP DX-format CMOS sensor
Includes rechargeable Li-ion battery, quick charger, rubber eyecup, USB cable, AV cable, camera strap, eyepiece cap, and shoe cover

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.3 out of 5 stars262 ratings4.3 out of 5 stars
